title: Bob.Omb's Win10PE x64 Bootable AIO Repair / Rescue USB Tool v0.4
description:
========================================================= 
--- Bob.Omb's Modified Win10PEx64 --- 
========================================================= 
Release v0.4 

First! This would not be possible without all the time 
dedication of the entire team over at TheOven.org! 

------------This Project is based on Win10PESE----------- 

Special thanks to ChrisR, JFX, and Lancelot.. 

And much respect to other releases as they are my 
motivation: Gandalf, Sergei Strelec, KYHI 

========================================================= 

4 Easy Steps: 
Download/Unzip 
View Readme 
Burn With Rufus 
Prepare OSimages Folder 

========================================================= 

The PE was designed not only to maintain, but also to install 
XP/VISTA/7/8/8.1/10, provided that you prepair the drive 
your using by following the ReadMe.txt. You'll need to download 
and place the ISO's onto your drive, after burning it with Rufus. 

You can use this bootable USB to repair/backup/restore 
almost any modern computer. 

Also included are ONLY reliable utilities. No clutter, 
this release was built with the intention of giving the 
end user all the tools they need, without all the extra 
nonsense. Easy to understand and use. 

General Overview of Capabilities: 
Backup / Restore hard disks and partitions 
Test Hard Drives 
Recover Lost Data from PC/Mac/Linux disks
Recover Product Keys 
Remove malware and viruses 
Install any Version of Windows 
ReFS Enabled (Now Backwards Compatible in v0.3)* 
Backup Drivers 
Remote connect to other machines -or- this drive from anywhere 
Reset Passwords 
And much more! 

========================================================= 

To connect to a network: 
(Wired network will autostart with DHCP - no action 
needed) 

Wireless Networks: 
1.) Right click the network icon on the bottom right of 
the screen and select "Show GUI" 

2.) FIRST choose your adapter from the dropdown menu 
(Pick your Wireless adapter, it usually isnt selected by 
default) 

3.) Click on the wireless tab, then select your network 
from the list and click the "Connect" button 

4.) Enter credentials and close the config window... 
Done!
